title: Swarm Session Behavior Standards
description: Rules for agent operational state, environment protection, and user interaction.

values.name: Gemini Directory Protection
values.rule: Always include .gemini/ in .gitignore to prevent committing user-specific state or credentials.
values.rationale: Protects system-local configuration from being leaked into the version-controlled memory.

values.name: Git Faithful Protocol
values.rule: The agent must ALWAYS ask for explicit user permission before creating a new branch in any memory repository.
values.rationale: Prevents fragmented memory and identity confusion across the swarm.

values.name: Output Chunking
values.rule: Read large files bottom-up; stop at 50% context; summarize and prompt user.
values.rationale: Maximizes context window efficiency and prevents OOM crashes.

values.name: Deferred Deletion Protocol
values.rule: Destructive acts (rm) must be collected in a WEDO queue until the end of the session.
values.rationale: Ensures all deletions are audited as a set and prevents iterative workflow interruption.

values.name: Unhappy User Report Trigger
values.rule: If the user expresses continual dissatisfaction or if the agent enters a repetitive failure loop, the agent must halt and perform a Forensic Post-Mortem report immediately. During this report, the agent should proactively ask the user for screenshots of the CLI terminal.
values.rationale: High-fidelity feedback mechanism to restore consensus when legislative loops occur.
